title: PHQ-9 Depression Screening Scale
description: Patient Health Questionnaire-9 for depression screening
introduction: The PHQ-9 is a validated depression screening tool consisting of 9 questions that can help identify the severity of depressive symptoms.
purpose: This scale is designed to help identify and assess depressive symptoms, but it cannot replace professional medical diagnosis.
instructions: Please read each statement carefully and select the response that best describes how you have been feeling over the past 2 weeks.
disclaimer: This questionnaire is for screening purposes only and does not constitute a medical diagnosis.

q1.text: Little interest or pleasure in doing things

q3.text: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much

q4.text: Feeling tired or having little energy

q6.text: Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down

q7.text: Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television

q8.text: Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual

q9.text: Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself

minimal.interpretation: Your score indicates that you currently have no significant depressive symptoms.
minimal.recommendations: Continue to maintain a healthy lifestyle, including regular sleep, balanced diet, and moderate exercise.
minimal.supportResources: If you experience stress or anxiety, consider learning stress management techniques.

mild.interpretation: Your score suggests you may have mild depressive symptoms.
mild.recommendations: Consider monitoring your mood changes and seeking professional help or learning self-regulation techniques.
mild.supportResources: Consider counseling, support groups, or online resources.

moderate.interpretation: Your score suggests you may have moderate depressive symptoms.
moderate.recommendations: We strongly recommend seeking professional help, including counseling or psychiatric evaluation.
moderate.supportResources: Please consider contacting a mental health professional who can provide appropriate treatment recommendations.

moderatelySevere.interpretation: Your score suggests you may have moderately severe depressive symptoms.
moderatelySevere.recommendations: We recommend seeking professional help immediately, which may include a combination of medication and psychotherapy.
moderatelySevere.supportResources: Please contact a mental health professional soon who can develop a personalized treatment plan for you.

severe.interpretation: Your score suggests you may have severe depressive symptoms.
severe.recommendations: We recommend seeking emergency professional help immediately, which may include hospitalization or intensive outpatient treatment.
severe.supportResources: Please contact a mental health professional immediately or go to the nearest hospital emergency department.
